record.author: Mary Raymond
record.notes:
Kubokota and Luqa are very closely related although there are some grammatical differences and, I feel, more lexical differences than this word list suggests (Kubokota has a lot of borrowings from Bilua, a neighbouring Papuan language).
Orthography: q = voiced velar stop, v = voiced bilabial fricative, ng = velar nasal, ny = palatal nasal, g = voiced velar fricative, j = voiced palatal affricate. All voiced stops and affricates are prenasalized.
record.classification: Austronesian, Malayo-Polynesian, Central-Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Oceanic, Western Oceanic, Meso Melanesian, New Ireland, South New Ireland-Northwest Solomonic, New Georgia, West

record.annotation: to wander or to go for a walk
also a verb meaning to own
a coconut crab, whose claws are not sharp
not sure if this is an earthworm or some other kind of worm
spider species - no general term (kolobai = tarantula)
Roviana borrowing - possibly avoro or gavoro; aruru = to blossom
rarely occurs without nominalization suffix na, even when acting as a verb
general preposition for inanimates; ta is for animates
in clausal negation the clitic =ke attaches to subject markers
puta 'sleep' is added to the decades but omitted when counting
